website_summaries.verdict: A great value if you like the idea of having several cooking capabilities in one unit.
pros: A versatile appliance capable of sautéing, browning, steaming, and slow cooking
Has a steam rack and cool-touch handles
cons: Care must be taken not to scratch the nonstick surface

customer_reviews.title: Use at your own health risk!
customer_reviews.text: Read other critical reviews and know that while this is a great tool the lining pan is HORRIBLE. After taking great care to prevent scratches and bubbling as noted in other reviews the lining has started deteriorating and exposes corroding metal under!!!! When I wipe the surface after washing it leaves orange residue on the towel. I'm not risking the health of my family by steeping my food for 10 hours at a time in a rusty pot. I purchased this product in Oct '15 and within two months noticed this problem, of course after the return period had expired. I'm rarely disappointed by this brand but, sorry cuisinart, this slow cooker is a loser.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: My first meal fixed in this slow cooker was perfect. The second time I used it
customer_reviews.text: Once again, Amazon stood behind their product. My first meal fixed in this slow cooker was perfect. The second time I used it, I seared the roast. When roast was done, I took it out of the cooker, and the non-stick coating was stuck to and came out with the roast. Very disappointed. Amazon sent me a return sticker, along with a prompt refund. Not disappointed in Amazon at all. Very disappointed with the item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This would have been a wonderful product except for by the third use I noticed ...
customer_reviews.text: This would have been a wonderful product except for by the third use I noticed that the coating was coming off. Apparently I probably ate some of it because I didn't notice until the food was out of the pot. Cuisnart is supposed to be at the top of their game in this arena; I don't know what happened here.
customer_reviews.author: L. Carr

customer_reviews.title: Functioned fine, but Non-stick BLISTERED within weeks --and, Amazon Return process flaws
customer_reviews.text: Unit had worked great, BUT the ($110+)non-stick started to BLISTER within a month on this unit. Decided to not risk a second unit of this model- - RETURNED for Refund (* ALSO, Amazon Return process was surprisingly terrible this time - have all return-confirmations from amazon, yet system charged my credit-card a second time - - required personal time to fix, needed to pay the additional charges to my credit card, and end-result was yet ANOTHER gift-card, involuntarily inflating amazon sales(again) - I'd been assured this would not occur. First bad experience, but little recourse - -could be anomaly, but starting to feel like an unwelcome trend.
customer_reviews.author: davem

customer_reviews.title: Non-stick coating issue
customer_reviews.text: After the second use I noticed two areas where the finish had come off. Used it again yesterday and found a another area where the finish had come off. Contacted technical support 3 times but have not received a response. I really like this slow cooker so hope this is just a unit with a faulty finish. Hoping they will replace the pot, not the whole unit. Until this is resolved and I try again I can not recommend this slow cooker. Unfortunately I purchased a second one as a gift but will return because I am not confident it will be any better than the one I use.
customer_reviews.author: jacr

customer_reviews.title: Accept and Submit
customer_reviews.text: Two months past warranty and it's having "electrical" issues with "err" message (unit is cold so can't be "overheating"). Used less than 6 times per year? So lets see, that's 99 / 3 = 33 per year / 6 = $5.50 per use. The non-stick coating flakes off "enriching" my meals, so there's that "bonus." If you cook anything with a cut bone (lamb, pork, etc.) It will scratch the coating while you stir or brown & sear thoughtfully with your no-scratch utensil. A delightful discovery. Will stainless insert work with other products? Perhaps...but go ahead and spend big $ only to have the electronics fail. Solution: Acceptance and submission to the Crockpot Capitalists.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Wysteria

customer_reviews.title: I give Cuisinart a thumbs down and dO not recommend buying.
customer_reviews.text: I lik e the idea but I bought mine six months ago and the inside of the cooking pot is flaking off. [made in China] . Cuisinart will replace BUT want me to pay shipping and handling to return THEIR defective pot. I give Cuisinart a thumbs down and dO not recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: B. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Pot doesn't hold up to heat
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my Cuisinart 6 qt slow cooker after years of use because the finish in the pot was starting to scratch and come off, well this one started to bubble after the 1st or 2nd use and is now not usable. Was looking at the $60 replacement pot but I think it will do the same thing. Plus screws on the underside of the pot handles are rusting... this cost too much to be this bad.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P.

customer_reviews.title: Major issues with non-stick insert makes this product unusable
customer_reviews.text: Like some other reviewers, I experienced issues with the non-stick coating bubbling up and peeling off of the insert, even though I was very careful and only used non-stick tools. I first noticed it after a few months of fairly regular use; submitted a warranty request with Cuisinart and went through the whole rigamarole of multiple emails, sending photos, paying for return shipping on the insert ($30) plus another $10 for them to send me a replacement. I finally received the replacement, used the new insert ONCE and experienced the exact same problem. Very disappointing, as it performed well other than the faulty, unusable and potentially toxic insert.
customer_reviews.author: robinelon

customer_reviews.title: ... I was really excited to order this unit and love the versatility of it
customer_reviews.text: I am torn on this review because I was really excited to order this unit and love the versatility of it. Although its made very cheap! The first unit that was delivered was scratched and Amazon immediately sent me another unit. Kudos for their prompt action on that. I used the cooker for the first time and after ONE WASH the screws that hold the handle on for the insert are already RUSTED. Come on Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Buying the most expensive not always pays off!
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived, we were impressed. Did notice a very tiny blemish in the teflon. After cooking corned beef yesterday, we noticed the size of the blemish doubled and it's actually the teflon coming off. We are two days past the return policy with Amazon. Not happy! 128.00+ Down the drain as I won't cook with teflon pieces in my food.
customer_reviews.author: Janis P.

customer_reviews.title: Coating came off the cook surface.
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my wife at her request. She loved it and promptly started to make fantastic meals for our busy family. Shew liked the fact that she could brown stew meat or whatever and make excellent meals without using multiple pans. Anyway, the coating began coming off cooking surface. So we thought we'd just buy a replacement cook pot. I managed to find them but they were expensive and hard to obtain at the time. SO, we bought a Ninja which does the same thing for not much more than cost of the replacement pot. No problems with the Ninja we have been using it for several years.
customer_reviews.author: S. Madsen

customer_reviews.title: less than promised and so is customer service
customer_reviews.text: After having the 6 qt unit for years, it finally started to undercook...off to the garbage heap it went. Decided to upgrade to the 7 qt but that was a major mistake TWICE. Tried two units but both had problems with heating to regular cooking temps. I contacted Cuisinart twice re the problem with the promise of a return call within 24 to 48 hrs...it took over two week for a standard form email message asking for more info. Their excuse was the busy shopping season which meant as far back as mid November they were unable to cope. Sounds like a poor excuse to me. I am less than expressed...not the Cuisinart of the past.
customer_reviews.author: S. Caporossi

customer_reviews.title: It worked great but now it's useless
customer_reviews.text: Bought this slow cooker for my daughter for her birthday 6 months ago. The teflon coating started to bubble and peel away. No metal tools were used while cooking, after reading more in to this problem, I see others are having the same issue but cuisinart has yet to address the problem. It's too late to return it. It worked great but now it's useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A+  Does it all - and perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This has been the extra well-worth-while kitchen appliance for me. A nice 2 lb pork roast, carrots, baby yukon gold potatoes and liquid. No browning or searing, 5 hours on high on the timer and a wonderful meal with leftovers. Just perfect. Easy clean-up with the non-stick inner. The heat is even and consistent - no hot spots or underdone spots. Because it is so reliable in all ways, I experiment more with foods for healthy, nutritional, and easy one dish meals. Will try baking next.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Problems with the teflon coating are real.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these. After a few VERY CAREFUL uses the teflon coating of the pan began to exhibit small bubbles and rough spots. I called Cuisinart and they immediately sent a replacement. After a few VERY CAREFUL uses of the replacement the same problem has occurred. I emailed to ask if the product had been improved in the interim since I did not simply want to keep sending for replacements. They suggested I buy a different Cuisinart model with a ceramic insert. Why would I ever buy another Cuisinart product? They haven't tried to improve or change this product -- they continue to sell it with a defect reported by nearly 25% of users. Good-bye Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great While It Lasts - Which Isn't Very Long
customer_reviews.text: This product works fabulously well. For about a year. Then, as others have reported, the Teflon coating on the inside of the cooking insert starts to erode and flake off. I'm on my *second* insert, too. The first time I was fairly certain that I never used anything more abrasive than a sponge to clean it. The second time I'm absolutely sure of it. To add insult to injury, Cuisinart required that I ship back the old insert at my own expense or they would have charged me. The shipping wasn't cheap, either.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Podvoll

customer_reviews.title: Poor insert, good interface/option set
customer_reviews.text: Although I like the interface and options set with it, the insert is very bad. I have the same issue as a lot of other reviewers where the Teflon just tears off and leave a lot of white spots. Considering the insert replacement costs more than most other slow cookers units, I hope it doesn't wear out like the existing one. I will also complain that the insert is only available from Cuisinart, and they are ridiculously slow to process the order.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Laczynski

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite slow cooker ever.
customer_reviews.text: Best. Crockpot. Ever. We've had a variety of slow cookers over the years, but have grown tired of the uneven cooking, burning, sticking, etc. of other cookers. After doing research, we decided to try spending the extra money for this one and it was TOTALLY WORTH IT. The timer is great, of course, and the multi-function is awesome (you can cook/brown your meat before slow cooking it - SO CONVENIENT!), but also the cooking is EVEN and as expected and doesn't burn your food unexpectedly or cook it way hotter than you were expecting based on a "low" setting. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: A. Allen

customer_reviews.title: finally gave up
customer_reviews.text: I had this cooker for two years. Last year, the manufacturer was good enough to replace the metal insert because the coating was flaking off even though I had to pay shipping to send the bad insert back to them. Recently, the replacement insert's coating started chipping off just like the original. I finally just trashed everything and bought another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Yawn

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product & customer service Received for Christmas
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product & customer service Received for Christmas. Cooked in it once two weeks later. Teflon coating bubbled up on the pot. Amazon Prime wouldn't take it back. Cuisinart wanted $10 to replace pot AND I had to pay for shipping to return original defective pot before they would ship new one! And Cuisinart says its got a 3 yr. warranty! Don't be duped! You pay for it! And this all happened within a few weeks of original purchase. Will never buy Cuisinart again! Go read the posts on FB...not ONE positive post about any of their products. Wish I had done that FIRST. Trash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Insert does not hold up
customer_reviews.text: Owned this crock pot less than a year and the non-stick coating is already bubbling off. To cash in on the warranty, I must pay shipping to them and $10 toward shipping back to me. This is not much of a warranty when a new insert is only $60. This was a very expensive purchase. My last Crock Pot brand slow cooker lasted over 5 years!
customer_reviews.author: EC_Tjaden

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware! Will stop working within first year....
customer_reviews.text: I loved this crockpot until it stopped working. Cuisinart has in their warranty that the consumer must pay $10 for shipping the new crockpot to them and then we pay all of the shipping expense to get the old one back to them. Surely, when consumers pay almost $200 for a crockpot, they expect to work at LEAST a full year, but truly many many more. VERY DISAPPOINTED! Why aren't companies concerned with their customers anymore?
customer_reviews.author: A. Yeager

customer_reviews.title: non-stick finish problem & poor  cuisinart customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Cuisinart MSC-600 3-in-1 slow cooker January 2017 & it's under warranty. The nonstick coating is flaking off 3 months after gentle use & following the manual's recommended utensil use & cleaning etc. of this insert. I Talked with Cuisinart customer service & they would replace only at customer's (my)expense.....$10check to them plus my paying to mail the insert back to them! Customer service had no info on whether the coating has been improved so there's no reason to expect the finish wouldn't flake off on a replacement. I don't think I should have shipping costs to do this return or pay them $10 to cover their shipping. This is clearly a defective finish.
customer_reviews.author: JOEL

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: The very first time I used this product, the nonstick coating started to come off. I will be returning for this reason. However, I was happy with the accuracy of the temperature that it slow cooks at. In other crock pots, the warm setting seems to boil any dips I make. This crock pot kept the dip I made nice and velvety for the entire duration of the party I was hosting, therefore I am adding one star for that, as well as the convenience of browning meat in the unit. It works very well! If the problem with the nonstick coating could be fixed (it seems many have issues with this), this small appliance would be a winner.
customer_reviews.author: MMJ2009

customer_reviews.title: This product is literally crap. I had it for 6 weeks (used once ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is literally crap. I had it for 6 weeks (used once a week). It worked well until t stopped working just this past week. I considered seeing if I can get it serviced but just waiting on those calls for 15 minutes plus is not worth my time. I'm getting rid of it and trying a new brand. No product should last 6 weeks. Plus this is a pricier item. I do not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Belsuzarri

customer_reviews.title: Better than Crockpot
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cooker better than the older style crock pots. The center pot is easy to remove, light weight and cleans so much easier than the old ceramic types. The other plus is that the display is easy to see. I that I have used it, I think it actually cooks quicker than the conventional crockpot. It is also nice that when cooking cycle is done it then goes to an automatic warmer function. The whole unit is light weight and for us older folks, that is a luxury.
customer_reviews.author: PAC

customer_reviews.title: Great slow cooker does saute very well
customer_reviews.text: Received this on Wednesday, yesterday I made a 5 lb. Eye roast slow cooked with carrots, celery and whole potatoes this is not my wife's favorite meal she really doesn't like this type of cooked beef, but she loved it and today made vegetable beef soup. Again this came out fantastic hope this cooker works like this for years. Great product. Would recommend 12-20-2016 Had to return insert is bubbling up just like other people complained about, If they could correct this it is a great appliance. Would consider buying again. Amazon.com that let me return it even though it was a little past return date.
customer_reviews.author: Tony D. Phila.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great and did a good job before this
customer_reviews.text: After less than a month of using, mine began exhibiting what I've seen other users have seen: the teflon at the bottom of the slow cooker has begun to bubble and flake away. During this time, I've only ever used wooden or plastic spoons. Worked great and did a good job before this, at least. Ordering a replacement, so hopefully this next one doesn't have the same issues.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Tumminello

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing pot defects
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a little over a year now. Cooks beautifully, browns well, etc. however there seems to be a flaw with the pit itself. I had Cuisnart replace the pot within 6 months of purchase as the costing was bubbling up and peeling. Now I’ve had the second pot for only about 6 months and there scratches that make NO sense whatsoever as I do not use anything but silicone or wooden utensils. The pics make it hard to see but they are there. I am going to be asking for yet another replacement. I expect better from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ammie

customer_reviews.title: Not so slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: We have used ours for 7 years. It’s worth the price for the sauté feature alone. One pot to sauté onions, veggies and brown the meat, then combine the ingredients to cook your meal. One pot to clean after your meal. And it cleans easily. Now the bad news. The pot’s Teflon does start to degrade after a year or two. We are trying to decide between replacing the pot or the entire unit. And even on the SLOW setting, it is easy to overcook a roast. Maybe 4 hours tops if you want any pink in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Non-stick surface deteriorates
customer_reviews.text: The non-stick cooking surface deteriorates quickly. We had high hopes for this cooker, based on the "Cuisinart" brand, and the very positive review from Cook's Country. But after several uses, the non-stick surface started to become pebbly and rough -- you could see and feel the irregularities. On the first unit we complained to Amazon and were sent a new one. Same thing happened with the second, only the problems started to appear after fewer than 5 uses. We don't want whatever chemicals that are present in a non-stick surface to leach out into our slow-cooked food!!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn C. Hartmann

customer_reviews.title: Bubble Bubble Toil and Trouble
customer_reviews.text: Thought I had carefully researched before making my purchase. So many glowing reports for this slow cooker. Used it twice and noticed the teflon surface had failed. Multiple bubble spots after only two hand washes and using plastic utensils. Seriously? Guess all the test kitchens only used it once. Sigh. Checked Amazon and realized I was not alone. Sure wish I had read the negative reviews better before making my purchase. I know there are many glowing reviews, but when most of the negative reviews cite the same problem...I'd say their is a manufacturing issue. Fingers crossed I can get this resolved satisfactorily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So wanted to love this multi cooker!
customer_reviews.text: I really did my research when I bought this multi cooker. I really wanted to love it. However after 1 use making soup I am really disappointed! I used a plasic spoon to stir the soup I was making only a few times, the nonstick scratched already after 1 use! Returning and onto looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Alethea

customer_reviews.title: caveat emptor
customer_reviews.text: The teflon coating on this product is an absolute joke. Go ahead and buy one if you like Tefon in your food. Shame on Cuisinart for putting a product so poorly made on the market. I for one will NOT be considering Cuisinart for any further appliance needs. There should honestly be a massive recall for a product that is this hazardous to your and your families health. If you want a really good laugh go to their web sight and price out a replacement pot. Use caution and don't be drinking anything when it comes up, you can thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: M. Schouten

customer_reviews.title: It worked great and we LOVED it at first
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband as a Christmas gift so he could make bbq pork shoulder and brisket. It worked great and we LOVED it at first. We used it every week and had so many good meals: chili, stew, bbq pork and brisket, steamed vegetables, dumplings, braised chicken thighs, spaghetti sauce. These are all things we can do in the oven but this is so much easier. Happy... until today when it won't turn on. So, like a few other reviewers, I have a broken machine after a few good months and we're out of the return period. SO frustrating. Follow up -- it started working again, but I still feel cautious about this appliance!
customer_reviews.author: busy Brooklyn mom

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy that I decided to spend the extra money and go with with this slow cooker. The first thing I fixed was a chuck roast. Not only did the Cuisinart brown the roast perfectly before cooking, most of the spatters stayed inside the crock so cleaning up my stove and kitchen counters was quick and easy. And I love that I can set the cooking time and it will automatically turn to the "warm" setting until I'm ready to plate the food. The crock is lightweight and easy on my arthritic hands. And the crock and lid clean up easily in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: janets98

customer_reviews.title: Coating wears off very fast!
customer_reviews.text: Used the slow cooker maybe 5 times and the coating is already coming off the bottom of the unit. For the money I would think this would last much longer than 5 uses. I don't utilize harsh utensils, I actually utilize soft utensils. We've hand cleaned the unit each time so this just leaves me to believe this is an inferior product! I would love to return it but it's too late for that so I'm out over $100! I would highly recommend you purchase a different slow cooker.
customer_reviews.author: JDAIrish

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed..
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed.... Love this brand but this crock is a health hazard. After about 10 uses - browning and slow cooking - the Teflon coating started to flake. It was just one small spot so I decided to use again. This time I came home to a pot that had switched from low to warm at hour 3 of my 10 hrs setting. I tossed $30.00 worth of meat along with the pot in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Kline

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great buy it now you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for years and as crocks go this thing is great. It slow cooks, steams, sautes and has a great timer and warm function. My family uses this several times a week and the nonstick coating is still in great shape and hasn't blistered or began peeling.
customer_reviews.author: Grimrivet

customer_reviews.title: Teflon coating bubbles and preals
customer_reviews.text: I too went against the reviews thinking Cuisinart would not put out a junk product. I was wrong. After my first use the Teflon coating bubbled, peeled, and it has only gotten worse. I am so disappointed, the features and trusted name are why I bought this product. While the features are awesome, how can I continue to cook in this device? What chemicals are leaching into my food?
customer_reviews.author: RationalConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money !
customer_reviews.text: I just got this and made pepper steak in it. Oh my goodness ! So yummy. This one was to replace my older slow cooker with the heavy ceramic insert and I’m definitely not disappointed. I have a bad back and this one is so much lighter to handle. I love the handles to lift the non-stick insert out, the cord that pulls out and rolls itself up into the unit base, the browning setting and it’s rectangular, instead of round. I love the size of this one, also. There’s just nothing I can say that I don’t like about this one. It was worth every penny !
customer_reviews.author: Maryetta M. Little

customer_reviews.title: This Item does not have a rubber ring in the lid to hold in the heat you neerd to slow cook
customer_reviews.text: I inside coating of this item is too fragile. I take great effort in caring for the unit, only using rubber spatulas to stir the pot, somehow my pot already has a tiny little nick. I also note no rubber ring in the lid to hold in the heat. Heat control is a little tricky as well. All said, I love the saute element, save on extra pans and extra steps in the kitchen, this is the main reason for the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: likestoread

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Loved it at first. After about 10 uses, despite using the proper utensils, the non-stick coating started to peel off. I have many non-stick pans and have had them for years without having this happen. It would cost $56 to replace the cooking pot.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Had for years & love it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the exact one maybe back in 2015. We love it. I recommend that you get at the 6 quart for small families. I love that you can steam, brown, cook & use as a crock pot. I have used everyone of these settings. I do wish that it had a timer on it so I could start it anytime I want, but oh well. Now it is 2019 & the digital buttons (settings) seem to be wearing out. I will be buying this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Penkay

customer_reviews.title: teflon cracks formed within a few months
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this product but after a dozen uses the teflon cracked--pieces of it popped up around the bottom of the pot. I hadn't ever scraped along the bottom with a utensil or used anything more than a natural-fiber sponge to clean it. I was serving and saw a scattering of holes in the teflon and chucked the food and the pot out (I tried to re-order a replacement pot but they were $56 and also out of stock...I assume because I am not the only one that had this problem). A shame as it gets great reviews and it was great for a few uses but mine at least was faulty.
customer_reviews.author: monona mom

customer_reviews.title: 2 months of use?
customer_reviews.text: This was working wonderfully for the first two months until it suddenly died. I can't even contact the seller as they have no contact info listen when going through the return process. What a waste of $120.
customer_reviews.author: Risa Lee

customer_reviews.title: After the third use I noted that the coating is bubbling off the pot.
customer_reviews.text: Others had noted this but I did not believe it. I bought this one because I wanted easy to clean. After the third use, I saw some build up on about 1/4 of the bottom that I could not seem to get off. Upon further investigation I could tell it was tiny bubbles forming where the coating was lifting off the base of the pot. Do not buy this as once the coating goes, so also goes the easy clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Cook Central. I use it at least once a week as a crock pot, for roasting meat, steaming tamales or veggies. Last night was Chicken & dumplings. This is so much more versatile than a crockpot and should be a kitchen staple. It says that the pot can go in the dish washer but I have found that the black outside coating will come off and the nonstick surface will start to chip and peel. Hand wash recommended.
customer_reviews.author: kitwitch

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, while safe to use
customer_reviews.text: Was awesome, until the coating started to peel within the year. Contacted Cuisinart and they offered to replace the insert when they got one in. Nine months later... I contacted them inquiring about the status. They apologized and sent an insert they "had in stock". Warranty was as original. This one started to peel after three uses. One soup and two pots of milk for yogurt. Disappointed, but while it was safe to use it was great. Loved being able to brown and learned it makes great bacon.
customer_reviews.author: savegreys

customer_reviews.title: Great, as long as you are ok with eating the non-stick coating
customer_reviews.text: The product works great and has a number of features I really like. The issue is that the non-stick coating on the insert bubbles and flakes off relatively quickly. I think I've used this maybe 10 times and the coating is coming off.
customer_reviews.author: Gertie1208

customer_reviews.title: The rack scratches the non-stick lining.  Not safe any more...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in November 2015. Although I've loved using it about once a month, I just noticed while washing it today that the surface of the bottom has four scratches from the four corners of the rack and silver metal is exposed. So now it has to go in the trash and we will be buying another one, but not Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: Cholmondley

customer_reviews.title: Beware insert Teflon bubbles off
customer_reviews.text: Love the cooking functionality and ease of use but extremely disappointed in how the insert's Teflon coating began bubbling off after only a few uses. No metal utensils were used when cooking, only wooden spoons and plastic spatulas. Didn't place in the dishwasher, always hand washed. It's so bad now I can't use it anymore because black specks of coating are getting mixed into the soups and foods cooked in it.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer946467w3

customer_reviews.title: Non-stick coming off
customer_reviews.text: We like this unit, it can be used to brown meet and make soup in the same unit. BUT the inner surface of the pot is now bubbling up and flaking off. We do not want to risk using the pot anymore. Wish it was better or even if it was made of stainless steel. We have had it for three years but $45 ($35+$10s/h) for a replacement pot? Not sure it is worth the extra cost if it is going to do the same thing, which by looking at the reviews it most likely will.
customer_reviews.author: JamesS

customer_reviews.title: Very Disastified with this product! & Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Very Unhappy with this my insert started pitting and bubbling and now i cannot use this! This was given as a gift and am wanting a new insert how do i get this? Can not get anyone to answer messages regarding this and very unhappy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: m berg

customer_reviews.title: Dinner was a disaster...had high hopes for this but it just didn't live up to Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.text: Sorry I ever bought. I cook for 9-10 every weekend and bought this with the multi-capability to replace my original cuisinart slow cooker. First use was a disaster! Roast pieces were on slow cooker mode for 10 hours on high and didn't cook the meat....tried changing the setting and it spilled out on everything....floor, counter...and shut the machine totally off. Had to transfer my meat and juice/gravy to the oven to finish cooking a dinner that ended up being very late! Will try to use again but not for roasts and not for 9-10 people. Keeping my old slow-cooker that never gave me any problems!
customer_reviews.author: K&F

customer_reviews.title: Bad electronics
customer_reviews.text: Loved it at first, but didn't use it much. Loved the steam function. Before I'd had it a year, the electronics quit, showing "ERR" on readout. Cost about $30 to send it back. Now I've had the new one about 6 months and only recently started using it. Have only used the steam function. Two nights ago the electronics again went out, again showing "ERR" on the readout. It's not worth spending another $30 to send it back. Terribly disappointed. All other Cuisinart I've used has been wonderful. NOT THIS ONE!
customer_reviews.author: ramonasct

customer_reviews.title: Not well made handles
customer_reviews.text: We love this unit however there is a definite issue with the handles on the cooking basket. The screws fall out and the handles get lose. Iimpossible to get screws Tried to get a new basket but found that they want $85 for unit. Hey fir a few $$$ more I can get a whole new unit and not worry about burning my fingers taking the tray out of the base We use it more than once a week and love it. But the poor design and quality is poor
customer_reviews.author: Edward b

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this.  You will regret it.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. The pot is made with defective Teflon and it comes off within the first few uses. I never touched it with metal or anything hard because of previous reviews thinking that would save it. Wrong. Within the first few uses I saw bubbles and then they flaked off just from running water. I called Cuisinart and made them send me a replacement pot, which they did, and this time there were bubbles after the very first use. This thing will put metal flakes of Teflon in your food. Do not buy. Keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Upgrade to Yesteryear's Crockpot
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I've been using an old, 4 qt crockpot for years. But lately, it had been over heating my recipes even on the lowest setting. So, after some research on America's Test Kitchen and Consumer Reports I ordered this terrific Cuisinart Slow Cooker. What an AMAZING upgrade - - It seers, cooks (High and low), simmers and warms!!!! I wish I had done this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: BeachBob

customer_reviews.title: Non-stick coating that scratches easily - already on second pot
customer_reviews.text: What I don't like is that I have had to replace the pot twice because the non-stick coating scratches off right down to the metal. Replacement is about $60 directly from Cuisinart. I do not use metal forks or spoons, but do frequently make bone broth and the only thing I can guess is that the bones are gouging the coating. The browning setting is nice - I like not having to dirty additional pots or pans. Honestly don't know if I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: N. Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Nonstick Coating is Inferior and Defective
customer_reviews.text: The fatal flaw to this otherwise excellent appliance is the nonstick coating. The photos show the extreme pitting of the nonstick coating after ONE use! I cooked vegetables in it, used a plastic ladle when serving and the setting was on LOW (no high heat searing was done). Shame on Cuisinart for selling an appliance with a substandard and inferior nonstick coating. Do NOT buy this slow cooker until this defect is corrected.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorQ

customer_reviews.title: The browning feature is a plus plus plus!
customer_reviews.text: The browning feature is a plus plus plus! Well worth the money as you use only one pot. On my older crock pots I always found it annoying to have to brown in one pot on the stove top and then add it to the crock pot. This does everything in one pot with no messy stove and additional pot to have to clean up. I know many of you might say, "Just skip the browning" but believe me, it makes a difference in the flavor of your finished dish. I would recommend this even if you already have a crock pot.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: I love the design but not the tephalon.
customer_reviews.text: I both love the cooker and dislike it. It is very handing, it is a great size. What I do not like is the tephalon coating. It scratches unbelievably easy. It doesn't hold up and I have been very, very careful. Doesn't matter. Other than that...it is awesome, but I don't like the idea of tephelon flaking off into out food.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Coating peels off
customer_reviews.text: As stated by others, features are great and in two years, electronic components hold. However, coating is peeling off the cooking pot. Additionally, the Cuisinart customer service is obviously trained in creating a labyrinthine loop to avoid making good on warranty requests. Lastly, want to order a replacement part? Backorder plus they charge you $11 for delivery. In other words, yet another consumer goods company who doesn't understand what the words "customer" and "quality" mean.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Roucourt

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this expensive slow cooker!!!
customer_reviews.text: Beware of this slow cooker!!! Purchased in 2016 and use at least once a week. The non stick insert is a disaster as the surface becomes "pitted" and I only use utensils for non stick surfaces. The recent replacement insert has started to "pit" after 2 uses. I replaced the insert twice and am on my 3rd insert. Cuisinart replaces the insert for free but you need to pay for return shipping of damaged insert. I contacted Cuisinart for a refund and they do not give refunds. This is a more expensive slow cooker and it is disappointing that I am going to throw it away because it is a health hazard to cook on damaged nonstick surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Dena Strych

customer_reviews.title: Pitted & Bubbled quickly Cuisinart didn't respond to email
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and very versatile but started to pit within a couple of months, then quickly developed huge bubble that cooking liquid seeped under. We are very disappointed that we emailed Cuisinart with this information and the serial number to their customer service department and they did not respond. I expected more from Cuisinart and had hoped that seeing other people in the reviews having the same problem that Amazon would encourage Cuisinart to make it right with their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Dean R Bennett

customer_reviews.title: After no more than 4-5 uses the lining began to ...
customer_reviews.text: After no more than 4-5 uses the lining began to bubble. I contacted Cuisinart with no response. Amazon stood by the product and replaced it for me free of charge. Unfortunately the second one did the same thing. Within a month the insert coating began bubbling and peeling. This is not the quality I expect from Cuisinart. Do not pay for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Spiderman

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be more pleased! This little thing is a gem
customer_reviews.text: Bought this over a crock pot based on Amazon customer reviews. I couldn't be more pleased! This little thing is a gem. The 4-quart is perfect for sharing dinner with my adolescent son then having a whole Tupperware full of food to freeze for later enjoyment. It is easy to clean, the brown/sauté feature is powerful and also good for boiling down too-runny soups etc, and the unit is no frills. It just does exactly what I need it to do. And a good price! I have recommended this to family and friends who have also bought it and are equally impressed. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: efortescue

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it, Inserts bubble after min. use
customer_reviews.text: I have been extremely disappointed in this product. The insert started to bubble after a few uses. I contacted cuisinart and they sent me another and after 2 uses that insert is bubbling up. I had high hopes that this would be awesome but is is not worth the money when every insert starts to bubble with minimum use. I would return the product if I could. I am certainly not going to cook in it anymore. Save time and money by buying the original ceramic slow cooker, they last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Schweigert

customer_reviews.title: This is a second chance on this slow cooker. ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a second chance on this slow cooker. All other Cuisinart products I have purchased have performed as advertised. My first purchase of this slow cooker I hope was an anomaly. Second time I used it the temperature control went off scale high and reduced my recipe to carbon overnight. Luckily the smoke alarm alerted me. Contacted Amazon and explained what happened. Amazon agreed to replace the item and for me to return the defective slow cooker. So far the replacement cooker is one for one on performance.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin

customer_reviews.title: A++
customer_reviews.text: Love this crock pot! It has a browning feature so you can brown meat before using the slow cooker. Amazing! It has all the features in a crock pot anyone could ever ask for. It even has a rack so you can cook food above potential grease drippings. Clean up is a dream. And, the handle on the lid does not get hot while cooking!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Green Thai Curry!
customer_reviews.text: Green Thai Curry was a success! Bought this slow cooker based on the reviews and its ability to act as a 3 in 1 cooker. This device allowed me to brown my chicken prior to place all the ingredients in to slow cook. The green curry literally took 30 minutes to prep and about 6 hours to cook. The green curry came out perfectly and the chicken was surprisingly moist. Clean was a breeze since it is a non-stick coating. I can't wait to try other recipes and also to try out the steaming feature of this appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Tango

customer_reviews.title: Now that I have it - I can tell you that I really LOVE it. We like soups and this is perfect ...
customer_reviews.text: We are a family of two - and I thought about this for a while. Now that I have it - I can tell you that I really LOVE it. We like soups and this is perfect for that - but I've made other things - such as beef stew - chili - chicken dishes etc. The fact that I can brown foods that need browning - and not have to haul out a sauce pan and dirty a second pot. Another bonus for me is that the insert pot washes like a dream! Yes -- I do love it!
customer_reviews.author: Yetcher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the on the go person who wants hassle free cooking
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic slow cooker and roaster, i love the removable inside rack so the meat can roast like in an oven, or you can add veggies and potatoes later to roast under neath a chicken if you wanted to do that. I love putting beans underneath with a pork butt on the top rack and slow cooking before finishing on the flame. Very easy to use, the timer is excellent as it'll shut off on it's own so it makes cooking while at work a snap. Definitely eat out a lot less now that I can prepare an entire meal while I'm at work and come home to a fresh dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I bought this cooker for a premium price and have ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cooker for a premium price and have used it a total of 4 times since purchase. Recently while cooking some liquids spilled over the side and entered the control panel causing a short. I would expect this on a 30 dollar Crock Pot but not a $180 dollar Cuisinart. Hence I am returning this cooker and requesting a replacement. or refund.
customer_reviews.author: W. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: All of the different cooking modes work well. The insert is very easy to clean. Food turns out really good that we've cooked in it.
customer_reviews.author: Philip W. Baker

customer_reviews.title: not delighted anymore...
customer_reviews.text: I have been happily using this 3 in 1 cooker since I purchased it in April 2015. I have very limited kitchen space and with the brand name of Cuisinart and the reviews, I felt confident that I would be making an informed purchase. This morning I went to use it and no lights, no nothing. I confirmed that the outlet I was using was ok - connected my microwave and all is well with it, I was very pleased with the cooking results and will sorely miss its convenience. I will not be purchasing any more Cuisinart products...
customer_reviews.author: not delighted anymore

customer_reviews.title: Seriously I wouldn’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Believe the negative reviews. I used my slow cooker one time and the non stick bubbled and scratched off in several spots. I was very careful because I was concerned about this very thing happening. I should have believe the reviews and never bought it. Beyond disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.text: After only 3 or 4 uses the metal insert pan is blistered and discolored. I like that it does so many things like browning or roasting, and it is easy to use. But for this price, it should be better material for the insert.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Product
customer_reviews.text: We have used this 3 times. I am very disappointed in its performance and durability. After the first use we noticed that the non-stick coating was starting to bubble and come off. It also does not cook properly. We slow cooked a stew today and the lentils and carrots were not done after 10 hours on low. We never had this problem with our old ceramic crockpot. We have a Cuisinart coffee maker and love it but are extremely disappointed in this product by Cuisinart. Unfortunately we have Missed the window to return this product or we would have returned it already.
customer_reviews.author: MGJ

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: When we purchased this I thought "yeah - SUUURRREE it's going to brown things as well as the stove top. Well, it does - so awesome to be able to brown and crock pot now without the extra dirty pan. The simmer setting keeps long-cooking things at just the right temperature and the whole unit is so light weight it is hard to believe. We have never purchased a cusinart item that we have been unhappy with and still have a cuisinart sauce pan that was given to us for our wedding 31 years ago! This slow cooker appears to be of the same quality. Very Happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed! It did not last. The Teflon inside blistered all the way around the bottom of the bowl. I am shocked! To replace the bowl will cost $60. Terrible!
customer_reviews.author: Timea Ferry

customer_reviews.title: Best small appliance purchase in a long time.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this slow cooker! My husband's comment "I think things taste better than in our old slow cooker". The range of temperatures is great. I especially like the fact that when I want to thicken the liquid, I don't have to wait a half hour. Just add thickener and turn up the temp! Being able to automatically have the temperature drop to warm is an additional plus because sometimes I'm not quite sure when I will get home. Potatoes do not end up being mush from cooking too long. The 4 quart size is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Piggy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Two
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfectly sized slow cooker for two people. The 4-quart doesn't quite hold a whole chicken, but I cut the legs off of the chicken and tucked them alongside the rest of the bird. My old-school crockpot had hot spots and ruined a number of dishes. This Cuisinart is easy to use right out of the box and has done a much better job of finessing a meal. America's Test Kitchen picked a true winner with this one.
customer_reviews.author: All His 247

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying!
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying this cooker. I love being able to brown and then switch to slow cook in same pot. I would only use silicone utensils with it. I know not to use metal, but I did use a plastic (maybe hard nylon, not sure) spoon & it left a mark on the bottom of the pot. Not really a scratch, but still couldn't remove it. So after that I have been using silicone utensils that have some flex to them. Otherwise have had no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne M. Savage

customer_reviews.title: I love, love
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this crock pot (I've always hated the others I've used). The temps are consistent and the searing option is fantastic. HOWEVER- when we bought this, we saw where some folks were having trouble with the teflon coming off. We made an agreement to make absolutely sure we never treated it roughly-used metal utensils or rough scrubbing techniques (the teflon makes it so that you don't need it!) We bought this 12 months ago and now there is a dime-sized patch of teflon worn off. I'm sad because I know this is the beginning of the end. I'm just now starting to look into replacing the insert since the crockpot itself is so awesome.
customer_reviews.author: kylanc

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous appliance
customer_reviews.text: Has been my wife's favorite appliance purchase we have every made. Allows for great cooking versatility.
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Musco

customer_reviews.title: SO functional, but flawed
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED this appliance so much for the first few months of use. It could do everything - we used it to fry bacon, saute veggies and meat prior to slow cooking, soup, curries, steaming, everything. However, the teflon coating in the insert starting peeling and bubbling similar to what other users have experienced. Amazon stepped up with a full refund, so this is a huge plus, but I'm so bummed this product had such bad quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie

customer_reviews.title: Just simply AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: I generally don't write reviews but I can't say enough good things about this slow cooker. It certainly saves me browning meat in a separate and/or sauteing vegetables I want to add. I LOVE how light the pan is. I have to store this in a cabinet at eye level. It is so much easier to take down and put away that my other slow cookers. My husband and I are retired so the size is perfect. I can make a meal for 2 that generally yields us an additional serving - small eaters here! I have recommended this to so many people already that I thought it appropriate to write a review as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Jane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've only used the slow cooker function of this multi-cooker so far but love the timer and overall functionality and have been pleased with the cooking quality. I used to have a crock pot and liked it but like that this can do even more in one appliance. I have not noticed any difference from how a crock pot cooks and like that it can be set to switch to warm after a cook time is reached. I really enjoy the Cuisinart build quality and appearance so I expect this to last me for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: John Rensberger

customer_reviews.title: Died after barely one year of light usage
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Cuisinart slow cooker in July of 2013. I absolutely loved it up until today, barely one year later, when I discovered it no longer works. I had liked it so much I bought another one for our other home. Now I'm afraid the second one will also die prematurely. And it is not an inexpensive loss. I am going to contact Amazon to see if they will replace it...it has only been 14 months since the purchase, and I was at our other home for 5 of those months. Yesterday I would've highly recommended the device...today it is garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Lynnie

customer_reviews.title: Good crockpot, terrible teflon finish.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great crockpot with the exception of the chipping teflon finish. It had some chips out of the box and has only gotten worse as we use it.
customer_reviews.author: heybobo

customer_reviews.title: I wasted time on the phone and got a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: After using this Cuisinart slow cooker (MSC-600 3-in-1, 6 quart) twice, the Teflon began to peel away from the bottom of the container, making the slow cooker unusable. Neither Amazon nor the third party seller would allow us to return it because we'd had it for a few months, which was longer then their return time frame. I wasted time on the phone and got a lot of run around. The product and our overall customer experience was unsatisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great slow cooker!
customer_reviews.text: I had asked for this Crock Pot for Christmas, but didn't receive it, so I purchased it for myself! I've used it a number of times and love it. It's super easy to clean and cooks incredibly well. My only (very) minor complaint is that I wish I could turn off the beeping sound when setting the time and temp, it's fairly loud and freaks out my dog. But again, that's a minor issue and I still love it all the same.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Risko

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE
customer_reviews.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this slowcooker! I've only had 1 week and I've already cooked a 3lb pork roast, short ribs for Korean lettuce wraps and I have sloppy joe meat simmering today. My favorite feature is the browning ability in the unit! No more browning on the stove and pouring into the slowcooker. My last Crockpot had hotspots and tended to overcook because it was so hot. I've not noticed that problem with this slow cooker. My lid on my old unit also didn't fit well so heat and steam would escape...this lid fits very well so moisture stays in the food.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett

customer_reviews.title: is excellent! I have raved about this to my friends ...
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, yes, but it is outstanding!! After only having it for 3 days, I've already used it 2 times and plan to use it again. That it sautes (browns) food prior to slow cooking, is excellent! I have raved about this to my friends such that some of them are planning to purchase one as well. I have experienced no problems whatsoever with it, and do not plan to ever be without it again. My problem will be how to figure out a way to take it with us when we vacation for a few weeks at a time at the beach. This is definitely a 5-star (or over).
customer_reviews.author: Bessie in VA

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart MSC-800 Cook Central 4-in-1 Multi-Cooker, 7 quart
customer_reviews.text: The non-stick insert in this multi-cooker was scratched after first use, when nothing metal was used for stirring, only soft plastic. Obviously, the non-stick coating is not the best. Otherwise, all features worked satisfactorily.
customer_reviews.author: Smart2012

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE the crock pot in every way EXCEPT that the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very mixed feelings about this. I LOVE the crock pot in every way EXCEPT that the non-stick finish is no good. The non-stick coating bubbles up all over the bottom, and in some areas the bubbles have burst, exposing the metal underneath, which is rusting. I have not used metal or any sharp utensils, this has just happened in the course of normal use. Even after the very first use, one or two bubbles appeared, but with repeated use, there are now many bubbles all over the bottom. Otherwise, I really love the control selections, the versatility, the ease of use, etc. But it is very expensive if it is only going to last a few months!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this cooker given how ridiculously expensive it is compared to other slow cookers that I've had. It's worth the difference. First, the browning feature is really handy. It beats having to use a separate pan. Second, it has many more settings than a typical Rival model, allowing you to turn it down to Simmer or even Warm to avoid overcooking. Third, it cleans up a thousand times more easily than a typical crockery model.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Joyner Jr.

product_meta.title: Cuisinart MSC-400 3-In-1 Cook Central 4-Quart Multi-Cooker: Slow Cooker, Brown/Saute, Steamer
product_meta.description:
Size:4-Quart

THE CUISINART COOK CENTRAL 3-IN-1 MULTICOOKER
The MSC-400 Cuisinart Multicooker Create one-pot meals your family will love with the Cuisinart Cook Central 3-in-1 Multicooker. Three fully programmable cooking functions let you sauté vegetables, brown meats and slow cook your favorite comfort foods right in the unit. Skip the stovetop with combination cooking -- brown your ingredients in the unit and then simply switch to the slow cook function. Use the Cook Central to prep any aspect of your favorite dish. Select the steam function to prepare stuffed artichokes to start a gourmet meal or to create a healthful vegetable medley side dish. The Cook Central can even do dessert. With numerous recipes to choose from in the included booklet, the opportunities are endless! 

The Cook Central features Cuisinart’s brushed stainless steel housing and a 4-quart nonstick cooking pot that lets you brown or sauté directly in the unit. Once your meal is ready, the unit will automatically shift to Keep Warm mode so your meal is ready when you are. Serving your dish is easy -- just lift the pot out and take it to the table. Clean-up is a breeze with the Cook Central as the pot, steaming rack and glass lid are dishwasher-safe. 

MULTI-FUNCTIONAL
The first step to creating your meal with the Cook Central is selecting the cooking function. 

SLOW COOK
Slow cooking is perfect for foods that require long, slow simmering, such as soups, stocks, stews, and dried beans. This function is also ideal when cooking tougher and less expensive cuts of meat like shoulder and pot roast. The Slow Cook function has three temperature settings -- High, Low, and Simmer. For recipes that need to cook longer, use the Simmer and Low settings. When starting a dish later in the day, select the High setting. A 24-hour timer and automatic Keep Warm mode ensure your food is ready to eat when you are. 

Brown or sauté with temperatures up to 400 degrees F. Use the extra-large steaming rack to steam vegetables. Slow cook on your schedule with programmable settings. STEAM
Steaming is one of the healthiest methods of cooking. No butter or oil is required and fewer nutrients are lost in the steaming process. To steam anything from asparagus to shrimp, insert the included steaming rack and no more than 1 quart of water or other liquid in the cooking pot and cover with the lid. Once steaming is complete, carefully remove food from the pot with a spoon, fork or tongs and enjoy. 

BROWN/SAUTÉ
Use the Brown/Sauté function as you would a skillet or sauté pan on the stovetop for a variety of recipes. Prepare a quickly sautéed skillet dish or brown food right in the pot as the first step of your family's favorite slow cooker recipe. You can use this function to reheat foods as well. Just use Brown/Sauté at 350 degrees F and stir until all ingredients are warmed through. 

Once you have chosen the cooking function that best fits your recipe, simply set the desired time and temperature, and then press Start. 

FEATURES AND BENEFITS
Glass Lid with Handle

Check the progress of a dish without releasing heat. 

Steaming Rack

Place in the up position to elevate ingredients for steaming. 

Nonstick Aluminum 4-Quart Cooking Pot

Spreads heat evenly to perfectly brown and saute ingredients right in the unit. 

BPA Free

All parts that come in contact with food are BPA free.

 

Easy to use control panel 

PROGRAMMABLE CONTROL PANEL
Cooking Function Buttons

Use to select Slow Cook, Brown/Sauté or Steam. 

Time Directionals

Use to set your desired cooking time, be it minutes or hours. 

Temperature Directionals

Use to set cooking temperatures up to 400 degrees F. 

Start/Stop Button

Use to start and stop cooking function. 

Blue Backlit LCD Display

Side-by-side display shows cooking time and temperature.
feature_bullets: Extra-large blue backlit LCD display with easy-to-read time and temperature settings
Glass lid with cool-touch handle for clear view and comfortable handling

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars2,851 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
